de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator

Class ListDialogDecorator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator.AbstractDecorator<DialogType,java.lang.Void>
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator.AbstractDialogDecorator<ButtonBarDialog>
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.decorator.ListDialogDecorator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dialog, DialogDecorator, ListDialogDecorator

    public class ListDialogDecorator
extends AbstractDialogDecorator<ButtonBarDialog>
implements ListDialogDecorator
    A decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items.
    Since:
    3.2.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        Dialog.Gravity

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        MATCH_PARENT, WRAP_CONTENT

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ListDialogDecorator(ButtonBarDialog dialog)
      Creates a new decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ListDialogDecorator

        public ListDialogDecorator(@NonNull
                           ButtonBarDialog dialog)
        Creates a new decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain list items.
        Parameters:
        dialog - The dialog, whose view hierarchy should be modified by the dialog, as an instance of the type ButtonBarDialog. The dialog may not be null

      • setItemTypeface

        public final void setItemTypeface(@NonNull
                                  android.graphics.Typeface typeface)
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Sets the typeface of the list items of the dialog.

        Note, that the typeface is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-set the typeface.

        Specified by:
        setItemTypeface in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        typeface - The typeface, which should be set, as an instance of the class Typeface. The typeface may not be null

      • getItemTypeface

        @Nullable
public final android.graphics.Typeface getItemTypeface()
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Returns the typeface of the list items of the dialog.
        Specified by:
        getItemTypeface in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Returns:
        The typeface of the list items of the dialog as an instance of the class Typeface or null, if the default typeface is used

      • setItems

        public final void setItems(@Nullable
                           java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                           @Nullable
                           android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Sets the items, which should be shown by the dialog.

        Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.

        Specified by:
        setItems in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setItems

        public final void setItems(@ArrayRes
                           int resourceId,
                           @Nullable
                           android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Sets the items, which should be shown by the dialog.

        Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.

        Specified by:
        setItems in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setAdapter

        public final <VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder> void setAdapter(@Nullable
                                                                                               androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<VH> adapter,
                                                                                               @Nullable
                                                                                               androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.LayoutManager layoutManager,
                                                                                               @Nullable
                                                                                               android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Sets the adapter, which provides the items, which should be shown by the dialog.

        Note, that the adapter and the attached listener are not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because they are not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-set the adapter and re-register the listener.

        Specified by:
        setAdapter in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Type Parameters:
        VH - The type of the adapter's view holder
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter, which should be set, as an instance of the type RecyclerView.Adapter or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        layoutManager - The layout manager, which should be used to layout the items, as an instance of the class RecyclerView.LayoutManager or null, if the default layout manager should be used
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        public final void setSingleChoiceItems(@Nullable
                                       java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                                       int checkedItem,
                                       @Nullable
                                       android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Only one of the items can be selected at once.

        Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.

        Specified by:
        setSingleChoiceItems in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        public final void setSingleChoiceItems(@ArrayRes
                                       int resourceId,
                                       int checkedItem,
                                       @Nullable
                                       android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Only one of the items can be selected at once.

        Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.

        Specified by:
        setSingleChoiceItems in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        public final <VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder> void setSingleChoiceItems(@Nullable
                                                                                                         androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<VH> adapter,
                                                                                                         @Nullable
                                                                                                         androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.LayoutManager layoutManager,
                                                                                                         int checkedItem,
                                                                                                         @Nullable
                                                                                                         android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Sets the adapter, which provides the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Only one of the items can be selected at once.

        Note, that the adapter and the attached listener are not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because they are not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-set the adapter and re-register the listener.

        Specified by:
        setSingleChoiceItems in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Type Parameters:
        VH - The type of the adapter's view holder
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter, which should be set, as an instance of the type RecyclerView.Adapter or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        layoutManager - The layout manager, which should be used to layout the items, as an instance of the class RecyclerView.LayoutManager or null, if the default layout manager should be used
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        public final void setMultiChoiceItems(@Nullable
                                      java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                                      @Nullable
                                      boolean[] checkedItems,
                                      @Nullable
                                      android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Multiple items can be selected at once.

        Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.

        Specified by:
        setMultiChoiceItems in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        public final void setMultiChoiceItems(@ArrayRes
                                      int resourceId,
                                      @Nullable
                                      boolean[] checkedItems,
                                      @Nullable
                                      android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Multiple items can be selected at once.

        Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.

        Specified by:
        setMultiChoiceItems in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        public final <VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder> void setMultiChoiceItems(@Nullable
                                                                                                        androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<VH> adapter,
                                                                                                        @Nullable
                                                                                                        androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.LayoutManager layoutManager,
                                                                                                        @Nullable
                                                                                                        boolean[] checkedItems,
                                                                                                        @Nullable
                                                                                                        android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Sets the adapter, which provides the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog. Multiple items can be selected at once.

        Note, that the adapter and the attached listener are not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because they are not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-set the adapter and re-register the listener.

        Specified by:
        setMultiChoiceItems in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Type Parameters:
        VH - The type of the adapter's view holder
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter, which should be set, as an instance of the type RecyclerView.Adapter or null, if no items should be shown by the dialog
        layoutManager - The layout manager, which should be used to layout the items, as an instance of the class RecyclerView.LayoutManager or null, if the default layout manager should be used
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setOnItemSelectedListener

        public final void setOnItemSelectedListener(@Nullable
                                            ListDialog.OnItemSelectedListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ListDialogDecorator
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when an item, which is shown by the dialog is selected.

        Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.

        Specified by:
        setOnItemSelectedListener in interface ListDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type ListDialog.OnItemSelectedListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • onAttach

        @NonNull
protected final java.util.Map<DialogRootView.ViewType,android.view.View> onAttach(@NonNull
                                                                                           android.view.Window window,
                                                                                           @NonNull
                                                                                           android.view.View view,
                                                                                           @NonNull
                                                                                           java.util.Map<DialogRootView.ViewType,android.view.View> areas,
                                                                                           java.lang.Void param)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDecorator
        The method, which is invoked, when the decorator is attached to the view hierarchy.
        Specified by:
        onAttach in class AbstractDecorator<ButtonBarDialog,java.lang.Void>
        Parameters:
        window - The window of the dialog, whose view hierarchy is modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class Window. The window may not be null
        view - The root view of the dialog, which is modified by the decorator, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        areas - A map, which contains the areas, which have already been added by previously attached decorators, as well as the corresponding views, as an instance of the type Map or an empty map, if no areas have been added
        param - The parameter, which should be passed to the decorator, as an instance of the generic type ParamType or null, if no parameter should be passed
        Returns:
        A map, which contains the views, which have been inflated by the decorator, mapped to their view types, as an instance of the type Map or null, if the decorator has not inflated any views

        Description copied from class: AbstractDecorator
        The method, which is invoked, when the decorator is detached from the view hierarchy.

        onDetach in class AbstractDecorator<ButtonBarDialog,java.lang.Void>
